text: First time try the five styles tartare. That's a good beginning and it leaves me a nice memory!

Super endroit. J'adore le concept, on choisit d'abord la protéine, 100g ou plus pour les plus gourmand; ensuite on choisit l'assaisonnement parmis plusieurs choix, mon préfère est celui a l'italienne; et puis enfin on choisit l'accompagnement. Avec ça on peu aussi prendre en plus une portion de frites parce que elle sont délicieuses, ou essayer la salade du moment. Apres une matinée de shopping en ville, j'adore y faire un stop pour un lunch tardif. C'est délicieux, frais, et vraiment abordable, N'hésitez pas, ça vaut le coup! Mon conseil essayer le canard avec l'assaisonnement italien et les croutons...super combo!

J'adore le tartare, alors d'en avoir un qui offre un menu diversifié et abordable près du travail, c'est fabuleux.   Décor: C'est vraiment plus un comptoir qu'une place pour manger. Je crois que malgré la petite superficie, ils auraient pu mieux l'aménager, mais pour le prix et la proximité, je ne vais pas chialer.   Nourriture : J'adore leur menu. Ils ont une grande sélection de poissons/viandes qu'on peut choisir avec un mélange d'ingrédients inspirants, ce qui rend le tout simple et intéressant. On mange le tartare avec des chips, croûtons, feuilles d'algues ou céleri. Ils ont aussi des patates douces en accompagnements et plusieurs plats de salades déjà préparés qui sont bons.  J'ai aussi essayé leur plateau de dégustation et le plateau de poissons qui permettent de gouter à tous les viandes et tous les assisonnements. J'ai aimé la plupart des assaisonnements, car ils ne viennent pas camoufler le goût du poisson. Mon préféré, c'est l'assaisonnement "Russe" (Vodka, lime, tobiko, betterave, oignon). Les bols de salade-tartare umami sont originaux comme plat, mais j'avais encore faim après.   Prix: Sur le site, le menu semble avoir changé, mais la dernière fois que je suis allé (automne 2014), c'était une sélection plus restreinte que leur restaurant avec salle à manger, mais moins chère. Pour les plateaux de dégustation ou de poissons, c'est des bons plateaux pour partager à deux avec des accompagnements ou avec l'ajout de quelques tartares. On s'en tire habituellement autour de 30$ par personne. Si vous avez de plus petits appétits, ils offrent de plus petites portions. En effet, on choisit entre 100, 150 ou 200g de viande/poisson.

Best steak tartare I've ever had; pretty lady recommended the Beef Italien; line was out to the door but they serve fast; beef Italien was a great take, the Parmesan cheese went well with the mix; the freshness and quality of the beef used was evident, like a fresh wild blue fin tuna , potato chips were freshly fried which was refreshing ; this small restaurant is a great concept; a lot of business people ordered the Japanese salmon

Tartare to go! Tartare to go!   Yes, it's called express for a reason. This is no sit-down place, although there are 3 tables and a bar .  I really did go there for express reasons and ordered a spicy style 150 g salmon tartare for 13 dollars. MMM, when I walked out of there and finally reached my destination, sat and ate that tartare...it was heaven. Spicy style is really one you all should try. In fact, it is sadly the only style I have tried since it was my first visit. But I have faith in the other style tartare.  My tartare came with these super amazing chips too...and I ordered a regular salad which is overpriced for what it was. That is my only complaint really, $3.50 for a small, ordinary salad. But the rest did not disappoint me.  Stop by this place for a light lunch if you're looking for nothing, and nothing but tartare!
I had the beef sliders tartare - the tartare itself was terrific, I'm not sure how well it worked on a bun, though.

Decent tartar.  Got the tasting platter with all four tartar. My least favourite was the Italian beef, very bland.  French beef was good, the caper really added some special flavour.  The salmon and tuna were good as well.  It was a good price ($30) for 4 kinds of tartar and lots of chips. Definitely satisfied my craving for tartar.  The express concept wasn't really my type.

Really cool concept that I've never seen it in U.S or E.U....or maybe I was wrong.  Basically, it's a small restaurant w/ limited seating where you can get multiple varieties of tartare, from beef, duck, tuna, salmon, smoked salmon, and veal.  We weren't sure the first time we ordered it, after eating a big platter of the tartare tastings...I was so glad that I tried it  Good flavor, you can tell that it's fresh because numero uno-I didn't get sick 24-48hrs later and you can tell by the flavor as well.  Affordable and I would consider it as a somewhat healthy option for lunch..unless you can't eat raw protein then it's not so good...  Give this place a try when you're in Montreal, QC, it's located very close to the shopping district.

I loved it. Went there with my boyfriend on sunday and ordered 3 diferent tartares (they have so many options of meat and styles is amazing!) - i loved them all! We also ordered a portion of fries and salad and the salad was specially good! The price is also great, paid 3,50 for the amazing salad for example! and we ordered good drinks and the PERFECT desert! i couldnt be more pleased with the ambiance service and food. Really worth the visit.

It is on the pricey side but it is really good.  You first choose what kind of tartar you want, then your sauce and then your side.  You have to pay extra for sides like french fries though as the included choices are chips, croutons or celery.  I am a big fan of the beef tartar with the spicy sauce which has a nice kick to it.   I like to pay extra and get french fries  as they are really good here and come with a tasty mayo for dipping.
